comments:
This happens when you press export in the feature.xml editor, or when you 
create a build.xml by right clicking plugin.xml and selecting "create ant 
build file".
Exception below shows this behavior. It seems the Constructor of the Config 
object always expects four elemets in the String[] without checking. Logically 
it should be ok to not have to fill in every field.
- Clemens

Creating a default plugin and a default feature I can not reproduce. 
Which values did you set?

I fiddled around a little and found out what triggers it. When you insert
values into the features "supported environments" area e.g.
os="win32"
ws="win32"
nl="en"
arch="x86"
you can create a ant script. If you now go into the dialog and delete for
example
Language and Architecture, your feature.xml file looks like this.
------------
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<feature
id="testFeature"
label="testFeature"
version="1.0.0"
provider-name="CD"
os="win32"
ws="win32"
nl=""
arch="">
<description>
zX
</description>
<copyright>
ZxzX
</copyright>
<license>
ZXzx
</license>
<requires>
<import plugin="org.eclipse.core.resources"/>
<import plugin="org.eclipse.ui"/>
</requires>
<plugin
id="testBug"
download-size="0"
install-size="0"
version="1.0.0"/>
</feature>
----------------
The empty strings for nl and arch then cause the command "create and build
script" to generate the dialog with the message "2" and the exception I
emailed you earlier gets thrown.
Let me know if you can reproduce this bug with the above info
- Clemens
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 50616 ***
